pullRequest.title: DHFPROD-5170: Remove the word "documents" in search results
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
Changed the word "documents" to "results"/"records" in various areas in the UI visible to the user to remove MarkLogic specific language.
Checklist:
- Note: do not change the below


Owner:


 JIRA_ID included in all the commit messages


 PR title is in the format JIRA_ID:Title


 Rebase the branch with upstream


 Squashed all commits into a single commit


 Added Tests


Reviewer:


 Reviewed Tests

beforeCommit.message: changed search summary language from documents to results

afterCommit.message: DHFPROD-5170: Modified all instances of "documents" to "records"/"results" in UI.

commit.message: DHFPROD-5170: Modified instances of the word "documents" to "records"/"results" in UI.

beforeCommit.message: DHFPROD-5170: Modified instances of the word "documents" to "records"/"results" in UI.

afterCommit.message: DHFPROD-5170: Modified instances of the word "documents" to "records"/"results" in UI.

nodes.bodyText: This is good, I think "records" works well in this context. FWIW, that's the term I found in the field to be most comfortable to users, who often think of "documents" as being things they create with Word and Powerpoint.
I think we can say "entity" here, but "record" is still safe, as "record" is always a safe generalization.
